alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 28 at 5:03AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following counties, Santa Barbara and Ventura. * WHEN...Until 800 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 456 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated a band of moderate to locally heavy rainfall moving into the across eastern Santa Barbara County. Rainfall rates with this band range between 0.25 to 0.50 inch per hours. This band will move east across the Santa Barbara area over the next couple hours and into western Ventura County closer to daybreak. Rainfall associated with the band is capable of causing urban and small stream flooding. Poor drainage areas may be flooded in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Goleta, Santa Barbara, Oxnard, Ventura,Camarillo, Ojai, Montecito, Santa Paula, Port Hueneme, Carpinteria, La Conchita, and Summerland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
